Catablepon are creatures that appear to be green bulls with reptilian tails. They are found on the third level of the Stronghold of Security. They drop the top of sceptre, one of four parts of the Skull sceptre.

They cast the magic spell Weaken (which appears as a spraying white sparkle) to drain to Strength, but will stop casting once 8% +3 of your total strength level has been drained.

Strategy[edit | edit source]

Players are not advised to train on these with Melee, as Weaken can drain their Strength quite significantly, which will affect the player's experience rates in turn, unless Strength potions or Restore potions are used (you can also use the Protect from Magic prayer). They can use melee and magic attacks often and cast Weaken at the same time. After the spell has decreased 8% +3 of your Strength levels, Catablepon will stop casting Weaken, but casts before this threshold can still bring you lower than the threshold. Ranged or magic attacks are recommended for those attempting to kill Catablepons.

On the west side of north-western room, there is a ranged and mage safespot behind the "Stinking/Dripping tendrils" available. Walk into the western door and the westernmost tile behind the tendrils. Another safespot is in the same room. Enter from the western door and stand against the wall beside the door. Finally, another safespot is available in the room right before the central room. Standing in the north-westernmost corner of the room, it is possible to attack the catablepons from a distance.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Their name appears to be a corruption of 'Catoblepas' (from the Greek καταβλέπω, (katablépō) "to look downwards," due to their head shape), a legendary cow-like creature from real-world Ethiopian myth that is similar in appearance, thought to have originated from encounters with wildebeest.

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 27 November 2019. (Archived from the original on 25 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "No, for some reason the dev has locked that roll so that only members can get it. The code doesn't indicate why, and the dev has since left the studio."
  2. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 21 August 2019. (Archived from the original on 09 September 2019.) Mod Ash: "3% from ankou, 3% from fleshcrawlers 3/101 for catablepon, 3/101 for minotaurs."
  3. ↑ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 14 november 2015. (Archived from the original on 20 April 2019.) Mod Ash: "There's a 1/101 chance from catablepon."
